name: Senior Contracts Specialist (EPC contracts)
description:
KAZ Minerals Russia is currently looking for a Senior Contracts Administrator.

Structural division: Contracts Section / Project Services Department

Reports to: Senior Contracts Manager (expat)

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Degree in business, law, engineering or equivalent preferred but not essential;
  • Minimum ten (10) years’ experience in a senior contract or commercial leadership role with five (5) or more of those years managing contracts formation, proposals, negotiations, strategy development, compliance reporting, claims management, bid evaluations and supplier/contractor performance management;
  • Experience as a contracts formation leader and/or large/complex contract management for a major international organization or EPCM company in mining, infrastructure, power, or oil and gas business sector at least two (2) years;
  • Previous experience in cross functional collaboration and innovation methodologies;
  • Advanced oral and written English and Russian language skills suitable for commercial negotiations and documentation;
  • Well-developed computer skills (MS Office at a minimum) to be able to implement and maintain effective systems and processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Implement and maintain contracting policy, procedures and systems, and monitor the adherence of these procedures within KMR and its contractors;
  • Ensure successful contracting of work and services through effective contracting in terms of costs, quality, quantity, services and availability;
  • Coordinate other team members, participate, train, and monitor individual staff development plans and performance reviews/discussions in line company requirements;
  • Use, monitor, update and ensure compliance in the contracting components of the contracts administration systems and related data and reporting systems, and provide regular management progress status reports of all contracting activities;
  • Administer contract matters relating to Government regulatory compliance, claims, disputes, invoicing/payments, correspondence, back charges, taxes, insurance, liability, indemnities, bonds and retentions;
  • Maintain standard contract documents and prepare formal contract documentation customized to suit specific contract requirements of the companies’ activities. Ensure all material changes are discussed and agreed with the direct supervisor and/or internal legal counsel;
  • Ensure timely and professional service in the preparation and evaluation of bids, negotiation with bidders, recommendation to management for approvals, preparation of contract documentation, issuance of award of contracts and regret letters, and, management and close out of contracts all in English or Russian language, etc.

CONDITIONS:

  • Regular work week (5 working days / 2 days off);
  • Location: Moscow;
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
